data.title: Running commands as tasks

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Could you help me find the right solution for the following scenario?
I have an extension which is a custom compiler. The compiler executables come together with an extension and I would like the user to run my executable through tasks.json (so that he can get all the problem matcher support, default ctrl+shift+b experience, etc).

The problem is this - the executables in the tasks.json must be in the current PATH, so it will not find the files inside my extension installation folder. 
The only viable solution as of now is to install the tools I need as another action (npm install, custom vscode command to install prerequisites, etc). But this is a bit sub-optimal, because a first-time user needs to do another action to install/update the tools and I need to have two different release processes - one for tools and one for extension itself.

Would it be possible to do one of the following:
- Run not only executables, but also vscode commands from tasks.json. For example, my extension registers a command called "MyBuild" and in tasks.json you specify something like {vscommand: 'MyBuild'; isBuildCommand: true}. Then it would be up to my extension to find and run the proper executable file in its installation path.
- Patch PATH of the process at the extension activation time so that {command: 'mycompiler.exe'} would be resolved when running a task. Did not manage to make it work.

data.title: Cannot read property 'charCodeAt' of null when saving untitled file in Makefile mode
data.body:
- new untitled file
- set mode to "Makefile"
- Hit Save

=> Cannot read property 'charCodeAt' of null

data.title: Infinite loop when closing several tabs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Win 10 build 14393.82

This only happened to me once. I closed VS Code and tried to reproduce the issue, but I was unable to. Here is what I did:
1. Open VS Code form command line by typing "code ."
   -- it opened with all of the tabs I had open in the previous session.
2. Right-click on the left-most tab and click "Close Others".

Instead of everything else closing, I got a really cool UI loop that I captured in a gif (below).

![scaryloop-vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/397836/18170157/4206bac4-702b-11e6-81b4-bbce2132919c.gif)

I went away for about 15 minutes, and it was still in that loop when I returned. I clicked the [X] in the top-right to close VS Code, re-opened, and everything was fine.

data.title: New macOS Icon
data.body:
The icon of the macOS client doesn't look mac-like.

You do not have to implement 100% of the macOS icon guidelines https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/UserExperience/Conceptual/OSXHIGuidelines/Designing.html

Some small fixes could help to align it with other macOS icons:
1. Make it a little smaller, it's too big
2. Add some color gradient
3. Add a little drop shadow

data.title: Find widget needs better responsive design
data.body:
IMO the last thing to leave the view should be the `X` action to close the widget. The first thing to leave should be the find counter.

Also, notice how the overflow goes into the next line and it still visible through some cheese.

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/18168558/a72715d6-7056-11e6-87b4-fb500480a257.gif)

data.title: Close tags as you open them
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. HTML tags should be automatically closed as I open them. This used to be available before, don't know what happened since I updated.
2. Also I should get snippets based on the CSS and JS files linked to the document. For example I included bootstrap.css in my html, I should get suggestion for all the style classes included in that css file.

data.title: Autocomplete Doesn't works in any language.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1

Problem:

Autocomplete doesn't works in any language. I program in Java, JS, C and Go and I have the correct Plugins installed like Java language support for java and also d.ts files from typings. But it just doesn't works. I have followed guides that I found on the internet but it has not worked one time. 

Also, Hovering over something should give a tooltip like popup with some details but it doesn't happens. It's plain notepad for me. 

I am sure that OS is not a problem because I was using it on 14.04 and none of this was working then I upgraded to 16.04.1 and it still doesn't works. And I have dualboot with Windows 10 and none of this works on windows 10. 

I am having this problem since last 40-45 days. All these features worked the first time I installed Vscode and it stopped working and hasn't worked ever since. 

Installing language specific intellisense ts definitions using typings is actually not reliable and it has not worked for me. 

I have no intention of wasting anyone's time on this problem and this is why I spent so much time tweaking things, googling and I have come up with nothing that can help. 

Also, code formatting plugins don't work correctly. 

Method's I have tried: 
Reinstalling vscode.
Reinstalling OS. 
Cleaning all the configuration files and reinstalling all the plugins and setting everything again

Nothing worked. 

Help someone.

data.title: Page-Up / Page-Down in git commit text box scrolls entire page
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In the Git view, enter multiple lines of text into the commit message text box, until the scroll bar appears.
2. While the text box is focused, press Page-Up / Page-Down.

At some point, the entire page is shifted up by approx. 15px. The tabs at the top are partly covered and there is some empty space below the status bar.

data.title: Debug console is shown when launching Node application with integratedTerminal

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
OS: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Clone [VS Code Smoke Test](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-smoketest-express) application
2. Create a Node debug launch to run the application
3. Use `integratedTerminal` as console in the launch
4. Reload the window
5. Start the launch

Expected: Integrated terminal should remain after starting
Observed: Debug console is shown.
![sep-01-2016 10-49-59](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/18161353/deb1bf62-7031-11e6-9c85-54aff01bbc52.gif)

data.title: Implement PHP symbol search

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.16

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Import a magento project
2. Quick search Mage_Catalog_Model_Product_Api_V2

Hello, I work on magento projects, and I would like to be able to search using class name. 
Example : `Mage_Catalog_Model_Product_Api_V2`

In `magento Mage_Catalog_Model_Product_Api_V2` => go to `app/code/core/Mage/Catalog/Model/Product/Api/V2.php`. So it will be able to find file if I replace "_" by "".

Can we do it by default or set a settings for that? Thx

related #11306

data.title: Swapping places of elements between each other that are divided by an operator
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Win7
- Language: Javascript

The most annoying thing ever in and IDE is the time you have to swap conditions, or parameters or members of an equation for example:

`var randomName = paramValue || $rootScope.paramValue;`
In this case maybe I want to switch them too... and for that I have to copy paste stuff to have something like this

`var randomName = $rootScope.paramValue || paramValue;`
This takes to much time, but if we could select the entire expression and right click a menu to say swap parameters... that would be super cool and the first IDE, as far as I know to do that.

Operators known to be useful: '||' , ','  all math operators.

data.title: The window is no longer responding when right-click to see the context menu without action on Windows.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Win7, Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Right-click in a cpp file or in the side bar to see the context menu.
2. Wait for a minutes.

It reproes with/without cpptools 0.9.0.
![norespond](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21057022/18160089/44b670d8-705e-11e6-8c3d-122c367f321f.PNG)
